<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A table of densely packed, null-terminated strings indexed by offset.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This table abstracts a densely concatenated list of null-terminated strings,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// each of which can be referenced using an offset into the table.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This requires and ensures that the string at offset 0 is also the empty</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// string. This helps allow zero-initialized offsets form empty strings and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// avoids non-zero initialization when using a string literal pointer would</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// allow a null pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The primary use case is having a single global string literal for the table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// contents, and offsets into it in other global data structures to avoid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// dynamic relocations of individual string literal pointers in those global</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// data structures.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringtable"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringtable/#ae5ab7503eda2c197884a390d06969dc7">StringTable</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Table;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An offset into one of these packed string tables, used to select a string</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// within the table.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Typically these are created by TableGen or other code generator from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// computed offsets, and it just wraps that integer into a type until it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// used with the relevant table.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We also ensure that the empty string is at offset zero and default</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constructing this class gives you an offset of zero. This makes default</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constructing this type work similarly (after indexing the table) to default</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constructing a &#96;StringRef&#96;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringtable/offset"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringtable/offset/#adcf9d70d3fa0fda9231651926aa39c91">Offset</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that we ensure the empty string is at offset zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Value = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
